column5: Anyone know if you can take preserved emerald smelt into Canada. Looking at Harmon Brook Farm website and thing of ordering some. What about wax worms?

Greetings,I have regularly taken salted minnows across the border. Last year, the Border Services Officers were strictly enforcing the limit of 120 minnows per person. I am pretty sure that you are NOT allowed to legally take wax worms into Canada. I was once refused and had to walk my waxies back across the bridge to International Falls. The lady at the US Customs office just smiled. I suspect she had a son or husband that fished. This was many years ago and I haven't taken wax worms with me since.Good fishing and tight lines!!
No smelt allowed. They were reproducing in the lakes due to the roe and milt from the smelt being used as bait.
